numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The headline is: The Opinions of Generations!.
2. The graph is noticeable.
3. More 15-24-year-olds voted than 40+-year-olds.
4. In the 15-24-year-old category, there are many countries.
5. Many countries in the 15-24-year-old category are more developed than countries in the 40+-year-old category.
6. I wonder why these countries have these responses.
7. I wonder why these questions targeted these generations.
8. I am a member of the 15-24-year-old category.
9. I am exposed to many online sources.
10. These online sources give me access to information.
11. This information is about the latest political news.
12. This information is about the latest social news.
13. This news happens in all parts of the world.
14. I think that this access to daily events gives me an advantage.
15. I think that this access to daily events gives me a more open-minded opinion about this matter.
16. 40+-year-olds come from a different generation than 15-24-year-olds.
17. 40+-year-olds were raised differently than 15-24-year-olds.
18. Many 40+-year-olds do not have the same access to the internet as other generations.
19. Other generations use the internet in their daily lives.
20. Many 40+-year-olds have knowledge.
21. Many 40+-year-olds are exposed to the media.
22. 40+-year-olds are exposed to the media in a different way than 15-24-year-olds.
23. I believe that a majority of 15-24-year-olds said that the world is getting better with each generation.
24. I believe that 15-24-year-olds will live in the world for a longer time than 40+-year-olds.
25. I believe that 15-24-year-olds will mold the world into their own world.
26. I trust the results of this graph.
27. I may disagree with the results of this graph.
28. I support UNICEF.
29. I am interested in discovering the reason behind these results.
